turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Madame (1961 film).
turn.2: Madame (1961 film) Madame Sans-Gêne is a 1961 Spanish-Italian-French film co-production, filmed in Eastmancolor and Technirama, and distributed in the U.S. by Embassy Pictures.
turn.4: The film was directed by Christian-Jaque and adapted from the 1893 play by Victorien Sardou and Émile Moreau.
turn.6: The film stars Sophia Loren and a cast of French and Italian players, including Robert Hossein, Julien Bertheau, Renaud Mary, Léa Gray, Gianrico Tedeschi, and Marina Berti.
turn.7: Was there anything interesting in production?
turn.8: "Madame Sans-Gêne" has a legendary history in France.
turn.9: Was it based on a true story?
turn.10: It is based on the life of Catherine Hübscher, born in Goldbach-Altenbach (Haut-Rhin) in 1753.
turn.11: What role did the laundress play in the film?
turn.12: She started off as a laundress who used to wash and iron Napoleon's clothes when he was a common corporal.
